summary: The 'Building Resilient Innovation, Digital Growth, and Entrepreneurship with Africa Act' (BRIDGE Africa Act) mandates the Secretary of State to develop a strategy—in collaboration with other agencies—to foster technological and business development in Africa. It calls for a summit with African partners, focusing on investment, entrepreneurship, and collaboration in areas like AI and advanced technology. The Act identifies key focus areas (finance, agriculture, health, education, etc.) and analyzes how US investments can support regional security and counterterrorism. It also defines key terms and authorizes appropriations.
